newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian April construction works up 40 pct y/y.
newsitem.headline: Croatian April construction works up 40 pct y/y.

text.p: The value of construction works in Croatia rose to 671.2 million kuna in April, or 40 percent from the same month last year, the State Statistics Bureau reported on Thursday.
It gave no monthly change from March. The value of January-April works increased to 2.0 billion kuna, or 51 percent from the same period of 1996.
The agreed value of building contracts for this year was put at 4.7 billion kuna, compared to 2.9 billion last year.
In total, some 4.3 billion kuna works were expected to be completed before the end of 1997 or 61 percent more than in 1996.

A total of 29,208 or 17 percent more builders were employed at construction sites in April, compared to last year. They also put in 18 percent more working hours or 5.1 million hours in total. These figures exclude engineers and technicians. -- Laura Lui, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
